course_title: Applying Theory to Public Health Research & Practice
class_notes:
BSHES PhD STUDENTS ONLY
Location:  Class will be taught in GCR 537
course_description: This course provides the student with advanced knowledge about the role of behavioral sciences applied to public health. Content includes an examination of behavioral theories and approaches that: 1) presently shape our understanding of health behavior 2) form the basis for most research agendas in health behavior, and 3) comprise "best practice" in health education and health promotion programs.
schedule_location: Th 10am-12:50pm in Grace Crum Rollins TBA
sections: Class Nbr: 6459, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: Th 10a-12:50p, Instructor: D. Operario, Status: Open
